business.headline: Sebi meeting today: What can stock market investors expect from meeting?The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) is expected to approve a set of reforms that aim to make the market more attractive for businesses and investors.

Giorgio Armani's will outlines gradual sale or IPO of fashion empireThe late Giorgio Armani has left behind more than just a fashion empire. His will reveals a carefully crafted plan for the future of his company. Here's what it says.

Gold hits record highs. 3 key reasons behind the rallyThe shine of gold is brighter than ever. Prices have soared to record levels, with global and domestic markets witnessing a strong rally. So, what's driving this rise? Three major factors are at play.

How seniors can unlock Rs 1.5 lakh a month from their home, explains expertRising medical bills and everyday expenses often strain retirees who have no pension. But for those who own a house, there's a way out. An expert says reverse mortgage can turn property into a monthly pension of Rs 1.5 lakh.

From income reporting to form selection: 7 must-do ITR stepsThis article outlines the key things taxpayers in India need to remember while filing their income tax return for the current assessment year, with a focus on accuracy, compliance, and timely processing.

Infosys shares up 2% on record buyback plan. Will existing shareholders benefit?Infosys shares climbed over 2% after the IT firm announced a Rs 18,000 crore buyback, the largest in its history. The offer, priced at a 19% premium, could benefit existing shareholders, though experts caution on execution challenges.
Dalal Street momentum: Top sectors to invest in todayExperts believe that from Q3 onwards, earnings should improve due to GST rationalisation and income tax cuts, which will start paying off.

Explained: Why SIP investors on trading apps must check XIRR, not just returnsIn SIPs, investments enter the market at different times. Some stay for years, others only months. Absolute returns treat them alike, distorting the picture. XIRR offers a more accurate measure.

Urban Company IPO closes today. Is it a risky bet as GMP soars on last day?Urban Company's initial public offering ends its bidding phase today after strong investor interest and rising grey market premiums.

Gold touches new lifetime high of Rs 1.13 lakh per 10 grams in DelhiGold prices surged to a new lifetime high of Rs 1,13,100 per 10 grams in Delhi on Thursday. The yellow metal has gained over 43% this year. Experts attribute the surge to central bank buying, exchange-traded funds inflows, and geopolitical tensions.

entertainment.headline: Exclusive: Demon Slayer star Sakurai finds India's Infinity Castle craze inspiring'Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba Infinity Castle' has created a cultural phenomenon in India, breaking advance booking records and thrilling fans with special midnight screenings. Sunjay Kapur's sister Mandhira praises Karisma, her upbringing amid legal disputeSunjay Kapur's sister Mandhira refers to Karisma Kapoor as her best friend. She praises the upbringing of Karisma's children, while discussing the legal battle over her late brother's Rs 30,000 crore estate.

Tamil Nadu government to honour Ilaiyaraaja, Kamal Haasan-Rajinikanth to attendAs Ilaiyaraaja completes 50 years in the industry, the Tamil Nadu government is all set to honour the King of Music. Kamal Haasan, Rajinikanth and several others are expected to attend the event.

Despite stunning visuals, the film struggles with weak storytelling and character depth.

Kajol, Twinkle Khanna say no to stale gossip and fake talks in Too Much promoActor Kajol and author Twinkle Khanna introduced their new chat show 'Too Much' as a break from boring and lifeless chat shows. The show, launching on Prime Video on September 25, will feature unscripted conversations with celebrity guests.

Anushka Shetty announces social media break amid Ghaati's dull box office runActor Anushka Shetty announced a break from social media amid her latest release, 'Ghaati's lukewarm response at the box office. She shared a note and wrote about focusing on work beyond scrolling.

Prabhudeva to make OTT debut as cop in Tamil series Sethurajan IPSActor-choreographer Prabhudeva is making his OTT debut in Sony LIV's Tamil crime-thriller series 'Sethurajan IPS'. The show delves into power struggles and justice in rural Tamil Nadu, amid a politically sensitive murder investigation.

Bomb review: Arjun Das's social drama fizzles despite good intentionsRelease Date:Fri Sep 12, 2025Bomb movie review: Director Vishal Venkat's 'Bomb', starring Arjun Das, Kaali Venkat, and Shivathmika Rajasekhar, is a rural drama that explores the themes of superstition and faith. While the film's messaging is commendable, the format doesn't lend enough to an enjoyable social commentary.

The Bengal Files to finally release in Kolkata after makers' unofficial ban claimsHistory meets hush-hush: 'The Bengal Files' premieres in Kolkata by invite only, making its bold take on the past all the more talked about. Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri's film will be screened in the city this weekend.

KJo jokes about The Summer I Turned Pretty, says Student of the Year did it firstKaran Johar recently drew comparisons between 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' and 'Student of the Year'. He shared a post on Instagram and stated how his directorial did it first.

general news.headline: Indian woman among 51 dead in Nepal unrest; Sushila Karki likely interim PM Live UpdatesAfter days of violent anti-corruption protests led by Nepalese youth that have left over 34 dead, an uneasy calm prevailed in Nepal on Friday. Today, all eyes will be on a key meeting on the formation of an interim government.

Can't be just for Delhi's elite: Chief Justice seeks all-India firecracker banThe Supreme Court has questioned why firecracker bans apply only to Delhi-NCR, observing that citizens across India are entitled to clean air. The hearing comes ahead of the festival season, when firecracker pollution typically worsens air quality.

Chased, beheaded, dumped: Indian man killed in front of family at US motelThe accused used a machete to fatally attack 50-year-old Chandra Mouli Nagamallaiah after an argument at the motel in Dallas. The victim was killed in front of his wife and son.

Just ahead of Charlie Kirk's murder, wife spoke of divine help in troubleErika Kirk, wife of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, posted a text from the Bible on 'help in trouble' just three hours before his death. Cuban who beheaded Indian in US is a criminal, was freed by Biden administrationThe attack took place on Wednesday at the Downtown Suites motel in Dallas where the 50-year-old victim, Chandra Nagamallaiah and murder accused, Yordanis Cobos-Martinez (37) worked. iPhone 17 Buying Guide: 17 Pro to iPhone Air, which one should you get?Like every other year, we again have four new iPhones — the iPhone 17, the iPhone 17 Pro, the iPhone Air and the iPhone 17 Pro Max. How Charlie Kirk killing will impact chaos-hit US campusesUS college and university campuses, once known for high-quality education and a culture of inclusivity, have in recent years been in the news for growing cancel culture and incidents of violence. Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
